alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Knox (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 31 at 10:27AM CDT until April 01 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...A mix of freezing rain and sleet this morning. Snow and blowing snow with periods of near zero visibility this evening and overnight. Snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Knox and Antelope Counties. * WHEN...Until 5 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, especially on bridges today, and on all roads this evening and overnight. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, with periods of near zero visibility this evening and overnight. Gusty winds and light ice accumulation could bring down tree branches and cause localized power outages.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
